meanings.definition: A large formal assembly of people.
meanings.sent1: The convocations at the school auditorium were always filled with excitement.
meanings.sent2: The convocations for important announcements were held in the main hall.
meanings.sent3: The convocations of animals in the forest for a meeting would be quite a sight!
meanings.sent4: The convocations of stars in the night sky created a breathtaking display.
meanings.sent5: The convocations of colorful balloons at the party made it a festive event.

meanings.definition: The action of calling people together for a meeting or gathering.
meanings.sent1: Her convocations of friends for a picnic were always well-attended.
meanings.sent2: The convocations of employees for the staff meeting were scheduled for Monday.
meanings.sent3: His convocations of toys for a secret meeting in the playroom amused his little sister.
meanings.sent4: The convocations of clouds in the sky signaled an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The convocations of students for the club meeting were organized by the president.
